name: Mark Esper
summary: Former Secretary of Defense who was fired by Trump in a tweet and warned that Trump's mishandling of classified documents placed service members and national security at risk.

keyStatements.quote: An irresponsible action that places our service members at risk, places our nation's security at risk.
keyStatements.context: After stolen documents were found at Mar-a-Lago

keyStatements.quote: No, and I'll tell you why. Because in my view, any elected leader needs to meet some basic criteria: they need to be able to put country over self, they need to have a certain amount of integrity and principle, they need to be able to reach across the aisle and bring people together and unite the country. Look, Donald Trump doesn't meet those marks for me.
keyStatements.context: Asked if he would vote for Trump in 2024

keyStatements.quote: There's no way I'll vote for Trump, but every day that Trump does something crazy, the door to voting for Biden opens a little bit more.

timeline.event: Confirmed as Secretary of the Army

credibility.background: Former Secretary of Defense, Secretary of the Army, and Lieutenant Colonel with extensive defense and national security experience
positions: Vice President of Government Relations, Raytheon (2010-2017)

oppositionReasons: Trump's handling of classified documents threatens national security
